task_templates.user_query: How many sessions are in the dataset and what's the average duration?
task_templates.notes: Basic dataset overview

task_templates.user_query: What's the total duration of data available in hours?
task_templates.notes: Query about total duration

task_templates.user_query: What channels are available in the dataset?
task_templates.notes: List available channels

task_templates.user_query: Show me the statistics for all EMG channels
task_templates.notes: Get stats, then filter to EMG channels in response

task_templates.user_query: What's the typical range of values for the joint angle channels?
task_templates.notes: Get stats, interpret joint channel ranges

task_templates.user_query: Keep only the left arm EMG channels
task_templates.notes: First see what channels exist, then select EMG left channels

task_templates.user_query: Extract the first 10 seconds from all sessions
task_templates.notes: Simple temporal filtering

task_templates.user_query: Focus on upper body motion by selecting relevant joint channels
task_templates.notes: Need to identify which joints are upper body from channel names

task_templates.user_query: Extract a 5-second window starting at 3 seconds into each session
task_templates.notes: Check session durations first, then filter

task_templates.user_query: Prepare data for EMG analysis: keep only bilateral EMG channels and focus on the middle 15 seconds of each session
task_templates.notes: Multi-step preprocessing pipeline

task_templates.user_query: Are the gaze channels centered around the middle of the screen or biased to one side?
task_templates.notes: Interpret gaze statistics to answer spatial distribution question

task_templates.user_query: Which modality has the most variability - EMG or joints?
task_templates.notes: Compare std across modalities

task_templates.user_query: How much data would remain if we only kept sessions longer than 30 seconds?
task_templates.notes: Interpret duration stats to estimate filtering impact

task_templates.user_query: For training a model, I need at least 100 sessions with minimum 20 seconds each, focusing on hand and wrist motion. Can this dataset support that?
task_templates.notes: Check session count and duration, identify hand/wrist channels

task_templates.user_query: Prepare training data: extract 10-20 second windows, keep only upper body joints and bilateral EMG, then tell me how many channels and sessions remain
task_templates.notes: Full preprocessing workflow with summary

task_templates.user_query: I want to study early motion patterns. Show me what channels are available, then prepare data with just the first 5 seconds and only joint channels
task_templates.notes: Analysis-driven preprocessing

task_templates.user_query: Compare the dimensionality reduction if I keep only 8 EMG channels versus keeping all joint channels. Which is more compact?
task_templates.notes: Multiple select_channels calls to compare options

task_templates.user_query: Extract 0-5 second windows. How many sessions are too short for this?
task_templates.notes: Check for sessions excluded by temporal filtering

task_templates.user_query: If I extract 50-60 second windows, will I lose most of the data?
task_templates.notes: Compare avg_duration to window size

task_templates.user_query: I need to reduce data size for faster training. Should I reduce channels or shorten session duration? Show me both options.
task_templates.notes: Compare trade-offs between spatial and temporal reduction

metadata.description: Task templates for dataset-agnostic tool-use training data. Templates work with 4 core tools: show_session_stats, show_channel_stats, select_channels, filter_by_time. All reasoning uses real-world time (seconds), never timesteps.
design_notes: All tasks use real-world time (seconds), not timesteps
Tools are dataset-agnostic and work with session-based format
Templates cover exploration, preprocessing, analysis, and edge cases
Complexity ranges from single-tool queries to multi-step workflows
Edge case templates test understanding of data filtering impacts
